comment: He won't post notes, so if you missed class you missed the notes. For test you can't go back to any questions. He is too quiet in class and expects us to understand everything on our own. Just don't take his class.

His abstracts are insanely convoluted and he doesn't even know what he wants for each assignment. The workload is insanely difficult and none of his feedback is positive. He DOESN'T GIVES YOU GRADES until the end of the semester for some stupid reason. He expects you to always be working and never take a single break. In other words don't take him.

I was a 4.0 student who put 40+ hrs into his studio every week. DO NOT TAKE! Condescending, laughs when you're wrong, won't tell you what's wrong, expects answers students don't know, constantly contradicts himself and changes criteria for projects. Disconnected from amnt of work assigned. Rude! No creative freedom. VERY uninspiring!
I don't know where to begin. Just don't take his classes.

This is the worst professor I have ever had in my life. The man is basically the Riddler. You never know if he is telling you to shade something or letting you know there is a fire drill. He also changes his grading criteria as he grades work and adds requirements while failing to tell students. In short, he is a great man but a bad professor.
I learned a lot about my design process. It was difficult but he challenges you because he cares and he wants you to learn not to do everything he tells you, but to form your own design.

For E-tech, he throws a lot of information at you, and the workload is heavy.  Try not to get overwhelmed and learn "some" of the material that he is teaching. You don't need to remember every detail, although he may want you to.  He gives out study guides, and guideline to test and projects.  Don't procrastinate, and you'll manage.

I honestly enjoyed taking his class. I liked that he pushes you to do more because it enables you to learn more about the project. He does talk a long time though, and he can be very confusing when it comes to getting his point across. He is still pretty helpful, and I do enjoy talking with him.

Talks for long periods of time, yet struggles to pinpoint what exactly needs to be done. And not only are his lectures long, but often irrelevant and un-inspiring. His design ideology is questionable, as well. He possesses a good-heart and uplifting spirit, but these are just minor condolences to his confused, irritated students such as myself.

Took his E. Tech Class in 2013. His thorough knowledge & understanding of materials is impressive. Lectures are clear cut, but he is often not. Take PLENTY of notes as his Powerpoints will not be available outside of lecture.  Asking him questions rarely yields a direct answer leaving you more confused than before asking. Overall a good class.

Prof Pittman is very knowledgeable and always willing to help those who ask.  However he is very vague with his instruction.  No one really understands what he's asking for, and when you ask for clarification, his answers are long-winded and unclear. He also assigns a lot of extra work, so studio consumes your entire life.

Pittman, as genuinely & truly knowledgeable as he may be, does not have much experience teaching first year students (As of 2011, he's only had one). So be warned; a lot of his lessons will go right over your head unless you ask a ton of questions or have prior experience with design/architecture. Very challenging, but can potentially be rewarding.

He's only difficult because his direction seems to fluctuate. He'll tell his students one thing and tell them the opposite, the next day. He's not cut to the chase, so if you ask a simple question expect a long and tedious reply, which may not necessarily answer your question. He'll make your head spin if you don't pay CLOSE attention.

He is one of the helpful professors I have met; always willing to help. If you show interest in class then he will give you his full attention. He will guide you along and point mistakes and will show how to correct them.At times hard to understand - he is a walking architecture dictionary, but you get used to it.

Worst professor I ever had at SPSU...I will never recommend anyone for him ever!!!  Think twice before taking him.  He made me hate my project every day even though when he would leave and I would start working on it I would love it again...not very motivating!!!

This is one of the worst professors i have ever had. He is late 95 percent of the time. When he tries to give you advice he just ends up confusing you.CONDECENDING. He interupts whenever you try to explain your ideas. He asks rediculous questions. And he LOVES the sound of his own voice and will go on and on about stupind things for a LONG time!!
